name: Apple Coffee Cake With Brown Sugar Sauce
author: Gail Law
summary: This is a scrumptious moist apple cake with a really rich caramel sauce. The recipe comes from Newfoundland.
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Butter a 9 inch round cake pan or 9 1/2 inch springform pan
Using a fork, work flour with brown sugar and butter in a large bowl until crumbly
Evenly press half into pan bottom to form a crust
Stir baking soda, cinnamon, and salt into remaining crumb mixture until blended, then make a well in the center
In a small bowl, lightly beat egg with sour cream and vanilla until smooth
Add to flour mixture, stirring just until combined
Evenly spread batter over crumb mixture
Bake until a cake tester inserted into center comes out fairly clean, about 1 hour and 20 minutes
If top gets too brown before cake is baked, lightly lay a piece of foil over top for last 10 to 20 minutes of baking
Cool in pan on a rack
Cake keeps well at room temperature for a day
Covered, it freezes well and is easily cut while still frozen
